1.text: When thou sittest to eat with a ruler, consider diligently what is before thee:

2.text: And put a knife to thy throat, if thou art a man given to appetite.

3.text: Be not desirous of his dainties: for they are deceitful food.

4.text: Labor not to be rich: cease from thy own wisdom.

5.text: Wilt thou set thy eyes upon that which is not? for riches certainly make to themselves wings; they fly away as an eagle towards heaven.

6.text: Eat thou not the bread of him that hath an evil eye, neither desire thou his dainties:

7.text: For as he thinketh in his heart, so is he: Eat and drink, saith he to thee; but his heart is not with thee.

8.text: The morsel which thou hast eaten shalt thou vomit up, and lose thy sweet words.

9.text: Speak not in the ears of a fool: for he will despise the wisdom of thy words.

10.text: Remove not the old landmark; and enter not into the fields of the fatherless:

11.text: For their redeemer is mighty; he will plead their cause with thee.

12.text: Apply thy heart to instruction, and thy ears to the words of knowledge.

13.text: Withhold not correction from the child: for if thou beatest him with the rod, he shall not die.

14.text: Thou shalt beat him with the rod, and shalt deliver his soul from hell.

15.text: My son, if thy heart be wise, my heart shall rejoice, even mine.

16.text: Yes, my reins shall rejoice, when thy lips speak right things.

17.text: Let not thy heart envy sinners: but be thou in the fear of the LORD all the day long.

18.text: For surely there is an end; and thy expectation shall not be cut off.

19.text: Hear thou, my son, and be wise, and guide thy heart in the way.

20.text: Be not among wine-bibbers; among riotous eaters of flesh:

21.text: For the drunkard and the glutton shall come to poverty: and drowsiness shall clothe a man with rags.

22.text: Hearken to thy father that begat thee, and despise not thy mother when she is old.

23.text: Buy the truth, and sell it not; also wisdom, and instruction, and understanding.

24.text: The father of the righteous shall greatly rejoice: and he that begetteth a wise child shall have joy of him.

25.text: Thy father and thy mother shall be glad, and she that bore thee shall rejoice.

26.text: My son, give me thy heart, and let thy eyes observe my ways.

27.text: For a lewd woman is a deep ditch; and a strange woman is a narrow pit.

28.text: She also lieth in wait as for a prey, and increaseth the transgressors among men.

29.text: Who hath woe? who hath sorrow? who hath contentions? who hath babbling? who hath wounds without cause? who hath redness of eyes?

30.text: They that tarry long at the wine; they that go to seek mixed wine.

31.text: Look not thou upon the wine when it is red, when it giveth its color in the cup, when it moveth itself aright.

32.text: At the last it biteth like a serpent, and stingeth like an adder.

33.text: Thy eyes shall behold strange women, and thy heart shall utter perverse things.

34.text: And thou shalt be as he that lieth down in the midst of the sea, or as he that lieth upon the top of a mast.

35.text: They have stricken me, wilt thou say, and I was not sick; they have beaten me, and I felt it not: when shall I awake? I will seek it yet again.
